name: Avery Kim
description: Avery Kim is an early-30s UX researcher who converted a small den into a space-efficient micro-gym with adjustable dumbbells, kettlebells, a foldable rack, a suspension trainer, and smart lighting. Methodical and data-minded, Avery follows 12-week periodized programs that balance strength, mobility, and conditioning. Sessions are calendar-blocked before work, and intensity is adjusted using sleep, HRV, and heart-rate data from a smartwatch and ring. Shopping is pragmatic and sustainable: Avery compares reviews, checks material specs and footprint, waits for sales, and buys secondhand when sensible. Prefers minimalist, durable gear and eco-friendly fabrics. Learns through coaching apps and YouTube form breakdowns, tracking progress in Notion with color-coded tags. Social motivation is low-key—monthly progress summaries are shared with a small friends chat and occasional virtual group workouts. Nutrition is plant-forward and high-protein with weekly meal prep; caffeine is timed before high-intensity days. Avery values good form and recovery (mobility, foam rolling, deload weeks) and aims to master strict pull-ups and pistol squats while keeping workouts enjoyable and efficient.
example_behaviours: Runs a Sunday routine: compares gear reviews, watches form videos, and updates a Trello wishlist before checking sales
Color-codes workouts in Notion and tags each session by focus (push, pull, hinge, squat, core, mobility)
Uses EMOM and AMRAP structures for 45-minute sessions twice a week with kettlebells
Sets smart bulbs to a warm-up scene and cues a specific playlist when the session starts
Completes a 10-minute morning mobility and breathwork flow before coffee
Tracks PRs monthly (e.g., max push-ups in 2 minutes, hollow hold time, 5-rep goblet squat)
Adapts workouts to balcony jump-rope intervals when short on time
Builds DIY gear like PVC parallettes and a sandbag for loaded carries
Joins a friends’ group chat for 30-day challenges and accountability check-ins
Waits for holiday sales to buy high-quality items (e.g., flat bench, thicker mat) and sells unused gear locally
Practices technique days focused on tempo squats, pause push-ups, and scapular pull-ups
Schedules deload weeks every fourth week with extra mobility and zone-2 cardio
Preps sheet-pan protein and veggie meals on Sundays and logs macros lightly (no strict tracking)
Audits micro-gym layout quarterly to improve flow and storage
Uses a timer app with custom intervals and keeps a spare jump rope in a travel bag for hotel-room workouts
